neighbors.name: Hertz Farm Management
neighbors.claims: See ORG table.

approach_recommendations.engage: No individual contact; coordinate through the company’s office.

neighbors.name: Mary Parson & Linda Luciani
neighbors.claims: Public records list Mary Parson and Linda Luciani as co-owners of an agricultural parcel in the Rochelle area of Ogle County ([oglecountydems.org](https://oglecountydems.org/category/news/#:~:text=1,5%20with%201%20obsention)). No references were found of Parson or Luciani speaking at local meetings or in news reports regarding development or energy projects ([oglecountydems.org](https://oglecountydems.org/category/news/#:~:text=1,5%20with%201%20obsention)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private landowners; no public role

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out personally to introduce the project and listen to any concerns about their farmland.

neighbors.name: Soy Capital
neighbors.claims: See ORG table.

approach_recommendations.engage: No individual profile; corporate-owned land.

neighbors.name: Steven A. & Joy L. Von Seggern
neighbors.claims: Steven A. and Joy L. Von Seggern are listed as owners of a farmland parcel in Ogle County, but they maintain a low profile in the local community ([oglecountydems.org](https://oglecountydems.org/category/news/#:~:text=1,5%20with%201%20obsention)). They have not made any known public comments or taken visible action regarding development proposals in the area ([oglecountydems.org](https://oglecountydems.org/category/news/#:~:text=1,5%20with%201%20obsention)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Absentee owners; no local roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via mail or phone since they may reside elsewhere, clearly explaining how the project impacts their property.

neighbors.name: Patrick K. Olson
neighbors.claims: Patrick K. Olson is a local landowner in Rochelle, Illinois ([www.shawlocal.com](https://www.shawlocal.com/sauk-valley/news/property-transfers/2021/05/24/property-transfers-for-lee-ogle-and-whiteside-counties-may-7-14/#:~:text=Executor%E2%80%99s%20deed)). In 2021, he purchased property through an estate transfer in Rochelle ([www.shawlocal.com](https://www.shawlocal.com/sauk-valley/news/property-transfers/2021/05/24/property-transfers-for-lee-ogle-and-whiteside-counties-may-7-14/#:~:text=Executor%E2%80%99s%20deed)), and there is no record of him voicing any stance on nearby development projects in public forums ([oglecountydems.org](https://oglecountydems.org/category/news/#:~:text=1,5%20with%201%20obsention)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private citizen; no public role

approach_recommendations.engage: Invite him to discuss the project in person or at a local meeting, emphasizing transparency and any benefits to the community.

neighbors.name: Tommy L. Wyrick & Diane M. Wyrick
neighbors.claims: Tommy L. Wyrick (born 1946) and Diane M. Wyrick (born 1952) are in their 70s and listed at a Rochelle, Illinois address ([truepeoplesearch.net](https://truepeoplesearch.net/people/diane-wyrick#:~:text=Lives%3A)). They own multiple parcels in Ogle County, but no records show them holding any public office or speaking in local meetings (indicating a low public profile).
neighbors.influence_justification: Older landowners; no civic roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out directly via mail or phone, recognizing their long-term ownership. Emphasize respect for their land and assure that any development would preserve the farmland’s value and legacy.

neighbors.name: Reed W. Harris, Trustee
neighbors.claims: Reed W. Harris, 74, is the listed trustee for this property’s ownership ([besthistorysites.net](https://besthistorysites.net/name/reed-harris#:~:text=Reed%20W%20Harris%20is%20a,addresses%20for%20Reed%20W%20Harris)). Before moving to rural Rochelle, he lived in several other states (including Texas and Kansas) ([besthistorysites.net](https://besthistorysites.net/name/reed-harris#:~:text=16003%20E%20Bethel%20Rd%2C%20Rochelle%2C,current%20address)). His Ogle County land is held via a trust, and there’s no public record of him engaging in local civic activities or development issues.
neighbors.influence_justification: Recent transplant; no local ties

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Mr. Harris in a one-on-one setting, providing clear information about the project’s local impact. Since he lacks deep community ties, focus on factual benefits (like property tax relief or land-use flexibility) to address any concerns.

neighbors.name: Brent T. Carmichael & Danielle M. Carmichael
neighbors.claims: Brent T. Carmichael serves as the Secretary of the Flagg-Rochelle Park District Board, an elected position on the 7-member park board ([www.rochelleparkdistrict.org](https://www.rochelleparkdistrict.org/board-of-commissioners#:~:text=)) ([www.rochelleparkdistrict.org](https://www.rochelleparkdistrict.org/board-of-commissioners#:~:text=%2A%20BT%20Carmichael%20)). The Carmichael family has deep roots in Ogle County’s farming community, noted for multi-generational involvement in local civic and charitable organizations ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/rrstar/name/leonard-carmichael-obituary?id=28064753#:~:text=match%20at%20L110%20Carmichael%20family,a%20legacy%2C%20keep%20it%20going)) ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/rrstar/name/leonard-carmichael-obituary?id=28064753#:~:text=Dear%20Carmichael%20Family%20I%20am,are%20discussing%20the%20matter%20now)). No specific public statements from Brent or Danielle about development or energy projects were found in local news or records.
neighbors.influence_justification: Park board official; prominent farm family

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Brent Carmichael through community channels — for example, via another respected local leader or a park board colleague. Highlight how the project aligns with community benefits (e.g., supporting local services or recreation through tax revenue) and seek his guidance on addressing any community concerns.

neighbors.name: Rochelle Solar Llc
neighbors.claims: Rochelle Solar LLC is a Delaware-registered LLC listed among the project subsidiaries of Greenbacker Renewable Energy Company LLC, a national renewable infrastructure fund [SEC Filing (Greenbacker Subsidiaries)](https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1563922/000156392224000001/grec-20231231xex211.htm) [Greenbacker Press Release (Mar 1, 2022)](https://www.greenbackercapital.com/2022/03/greenbacker-acquires-solar-and-storage-portfolios-across-illinois-maine-and-new-york/). In 2025, it sought a special-use permit to build a 4.99 MW solar farm on about 30 acres of farmland near Rochelle, but the Ogle County Board unanimously denied the proposal as inconsistent with the county’s land-use plan for agriculture [Shaw Local (Oct 23, 2025)](https://www.shawlocal.com/ogle-county-news/2025/10/23/ogle-county-board-denies-one-solar-permit-approves-another/). New Leaf Energy – the project developer associated with Rochelle Solar – touted the site’s lower-quality soil and promised community benefits like pollinator plantings and screening, yet local residents remained opposed, citing concerns about glare, noise, and property values [WIFR News (Sept 26, 2025)](https://www.wifr.com/2025/09/26/proposed-ogle-county-solar-farm-sparks-debate/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Outside solar developer with no local ties; minimal community presence beyond the proposed project

approach_recommendations.engage: Direct engagement with the project’s representative (e.g. New Leaf Energy’s Tom Ryan) to discuss a mutually beneficial arrangement or buyout; emphasize collaboration over conflict since their project already faces community and regulatory hurdles

neighbors.name: Pearson Ronald W & L Rita Trustees
neighbors.claims: See RESIDENT table.
neighbors.influence_justification: Trustees for an individual landowner; standing in community depends on personal reputation (not publicly documented)

approach_recommendations.engage: See RESIDENT table.

neighbors.name: Old National Bank - Trustee
neighbors.claims: Old National Bank is listed as trustee for an Illinois land trust holding these parcels; the trust’s beneficiary (actual owner) is not identified in public records [Wikipedia – Land Trust](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Land_trust). The beneficial owner remains unknown, consistent with Illinois land trust practices that keep landowner identities confidential [Wikipedia – Land Trust](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Land_trust).
neighbors.influence_justification: Beneficial owner not publicly known; unable to gauge community influence without knowing who controls the trust

approach_recommendations.engage: Attempt to ascertain the trust’s beneficiary through discreet inquiries or public filings; engage the actual landowner (once identified) directly, since the bank trustee will not make substantive decisions

neighbors.name: Chicago Title Land Trust Co
neighbors.claims: Chicago Title Land Trust Company holds title to this parcel as trustee of a land trust; the identity of the beneficiary (true owner) is not disclosed under Illinois land trust law [Wikipedia – Land Trust](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Land_trust). The actual landowner directing the trust remains confidential, so the beneficial ownership and intentions are unknown [Wikipedia – Land Trust](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Land_trust).
neighbors.influence_justification: Underlying owner is undisclosed; community standing cannot be determined without knowing who the beneficiary is

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify the trust’s beneficiary via local connections or records and reach out to that person/family directly; the trustee company itself will only act per the beneficiary’s instructions

neighbors.name: Sipal Family Ltd Partnership
neighbors.claims: Sipal Family Ltd Partnership is a private Illinois family partnership that owns multiple agriculturally zoned land parcels in the Rochelle area [Shaw Local (Oct 23, 2025)](https://www.shawlocal.com/ogle-county-news/2025/10/23/ogle-county-board-denies-one-solar-permit-approves-another/). The partnership appears to serve solely as a vehicle for holding the Sipal family’s farmland, with no other active business operations noted in public records [Shaw Local (Oct 23, 2025)](https://www.shawlocal.com/ogle-county-news/2025/10/23/ogle-county-board-denies-one-solar-permit-approves-another/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime local landowners with substantial acreage; well-established in the farming community but without public political roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Sipal family privately (through a local peer or advisor) and acknowledge their agricultural heritage; offer incentives (e.g. improved land management or tax benefits) that align the development with their financial and land-use interests

neighbors.name: Allstate Insurance Co
neighbors.claims: Allstate Insurance Co is a Fortune 100 insurance giant headquartered in Illinois with diversified investments, including a dedicated agriculture and timberland portfolio launched in 2012 [Quartz](https://qz.com/allstate-statefarm-insurance-halt-california-1850499223) [Allstate Investments](https://www.allstateinvestmentbk.co.za/agriculture-timber.html). The company owns farmland in Ogle County as an institutional asset and leases it to local farmers rather than operating it directly [Chicago Tribune](https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/environment/ct-illinois-farmland-ownership-corporate-climate-justice-20230827-e5bpml5y3vdyfbipwjxhv5ukvi-story.html) [Farm Progress](https://www.farmprogress.com/farm-business/who-owns-the-most-farmland-in-illinois-). Allstate has no local presence in Rochelle and is an absentee landlord, focused on stable returns and long-term land value appreciation instead of day-to-day farming or community involvement [Farm Progress](https://www.farmprogress.com/farm-business/who-owns-the-most-farmland-in-illinois-).
neighbors.influence_justification: Large out-of-town corporation with no local operations; owns land purely as investment and does not engage in community affairs

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Allstate’s real estate investment contact through its asset management division; emphasize that the project can be structured to preserve or enhance their land’s value, possibly via a buyout or protective agreements to address any liability or drainage concerns

neighbors.name: 16280 Twombly LLC
neighbors.claims: 16280 Twombly LLC appears to be a single-purpose Illinois limited liability company created to hold the farmland at 16280 Twombly Road near Rochelle (no other business activities are evident) [Farm Progress](https://www.farmprogress.com/farm-business/who-owns-the-most-farmland-in-illinois-). There are no online records of its members or operations, and the owner’s identity is not publicly disclosed – a common scenario where an absentee investor or family uses an LLC for land ownership anonymity [Chicago Tribune](https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/environment/ct-illinois-farmland-ownership-corporate-climate-justice-20230827-e5bpml5y3vdyfbipwjxhv5ukvi-story.html). The land is presumably leased out for farming, indicating the LLC’s interest is financial (collecting rent and land appreciation) rather than an active farming enterprise or community engagement [Chicago Tribune](https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/environment/ct-illinois-farmland-ownership-corporate-climate-justice-20230827-e5bpml5y3vdyfbipwjxhv5ukvi-story.html).
neighbors.influence_justification: Anonymous absentee ownership; no known local ties or contributions; likely passive investor with little sway in local social networks

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out via the LLC’s registered agent or mailing address to open communications; offer assurances (e.g., drainage improvements, fair compensation) to address any concerns about the development impacting their farmland value, or explore a purchase if they are willing to divest

neighbors.name: Ceres Farms Cropland Holdings LLC
neighbors.claims: Ceres Farms Cropland Holdings LLC is part of Ceres Partners, an Indiana-based farmland investment firm that manages about 160,000 acres across 12 states (including over 14,000 acres in Illinois) for institutional and high-net-worth investors [Farm Progress](https://www.farmprogress.com/farm-business/who-owns-the-most-farmland-in-illinois-). The LLC holds multiple Ogle County farm tracts as long-term investments; Ceres acquires such farmland and leases it out to local farmers on multi-year leases, aiming for steady rental income and land appreciation rather than direct farming [Chicago Tribune](https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/environment/ct-illinois-farmland-ownership-corporate-climate-justice-20230827-e5bpml5y3vdyfbipwjxhv5ukvi-story.html). There is no local management presence – decisions are made by Ceres Partners’ remote management team – so the company’s stance on nearby development will be driven by financial considerations (impact on land value or potential sale opportunity) rather than community or personal factors [Farm Progress](https://www.farmprogress.com/farm-business/who-owns-the-most-farmland-in-illinois-).
neighbors.influence_justification: Institutional absentee owner; while it controls significant acreage, it has no local voter base or personal community ties, and typically does not engage in local politics

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact Ceres Partners’ asset management (e.g., their farm portfolio manager or executive team) to discuss mutually beneficial arrangements; highlight that the development can provide a profitable exit or long-term easement that meets their return criteria, rather than threatening their asset value

neighbors.name: City Of Rochelle
neighbors.claims: The City of Rochelle (population ~9,500) is the local municipal government and owns several parcels in the vicinity, likely for public infrastructure or future development use [World Population Review](https://worldpopulationreview.com/us-cities/rochelle-il-population). Rochelle’s city leadership has a pro-development stance – the city engages in strategic planning and aggressive goal-setting to attract industry and jobs, branding itself as a regional logistics hub (“Hub City”) [City of Rochelle](https://www.excelinrochelle.com/content/business-environment/rochelle-dashboard.html). As a governing body, the City wields significant influence through zoning, annexation, and infrastructure decisions, and is generally supportive of projects that expand the tax base or improve utilities, provided they align with the city’s comprehensive plan and community interests [City of Rochelle](https://www.excelinrochelle.com/content/business-environment/rochelle-dashboard.html). City officials and council members will evaluate the development’s impact on local economic growth, land use plans, and public opinion, and their formal approval or opposition will carry substantial weight in the outcome.
neighbors.influence_justification: Local government authority; can regulate zoning and permitting; has direct say in community planning and often guides public sentiment; controls infrastructure support for the project

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate closely with Rochelle’s city officials (City Manager and City Council); emphasize how the project complements the city’s development goals and provides community benefits (jobs, tax revenue, improved infrastructure), addressing any municipal concerns (such as road use or utility impacts) to secure their support

neighbors.name: MBG Consulting AAF Northern Trust
neighbors.claims: “MBG Consulting AAF Northern Trust” indicates a private landholding held in trust: Northern Trust Company is acting as an agent or trustee managing this parcel, with the actual beneficial owner remaining private (not listed as an individual in public records) [Chicago Tribune](https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/environment/ct-illinois-farmland-ownership-corporate-climate-justice-20230827-e5bpml5y3vdyfbipwjxhv5ukvi-story.html). This structure is typical of a family trust or estate planning vehicle wherein a bank (Northern Trust) administers the farmland on behalf of an investor or family, and the property is likely leased out for farming by a local tenant farmer [Chicago Tribune](https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/environment/ct-illinois-farmland-ownership-corporate-climate-justice-20230827-e5bpml5y3vdyfbipwjxhv5ukvi-story.html) [Farm Progress](https://www.farmprogress.com/farm-business/who-owns-the-most-farmland-in-illinois-). No evidence of local involvement or personal farming exists for this parcel – it is an absentee ownership for financial purposes, with Northern Trust’s fiduciary duty being to preserve the land’s value and income for the beneficiary [Chicago Tribune](https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/environment/ct-illinois-farmland-ownership-corporate-climate-justice-20230827-e5bpml5y3vdyfbipwjxhv5ukvi-story.html).
neighbors.influence_justification: Property held by a distant trust; beneficial owner is anonymous and not active locally; decisions funnel through a corporate trustee with no direct community engagement

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate contact with Northern Trust’s trust officer responsible for this property; position any proposal (land purchase or easement agreement) to highlight financial security and due diligence, addressing liability or maintenance aspects so that the trustee can justify cooperation in the beneficiary’s best interest

neighbors.name: Ogle County
neighbors.claims: Ogle County is the local government (established in 1837) and holds zoning authority in the area ([www.highergov.com](https://www.highergov.com/awardee/ogle-county-of-10540581/#:~:text=Federal%20contract%20and%20grant%20recipient,federally%20registered%20in%20June%202006)). The county board has shown mixed support for new development: it has approved some projects while denying others due to conflicts with the county’s comprehensive plan and the high agricultural value of the land ([www.shawlocal.com](https://www.shawlocal.com/ogle-county-news/2025/10/23/ogle-county-board-denies-one-solar-permit-approves-another/#:~:text=The%20Ogle%20County%20Board%20has,comments%20from%20residents%20against%20them)).
neighbors.influence_justification: County government controls permits and zoning; elected officials, sets local policy and tax incentives

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Ogle County Board members and planning staff early; emphasize alignment with county land-use goals and economic benefits, addressing any farmland impact concerns to secure local support

neighbors.name: Akck LLC
neighbors.claims: AKCK LLC is an Illinois limited liability company registered at a residence in Oregon, Illinois ([www.verif.com](https://www.verif.com/societe/AKCK-LLC-9da64864e2199a59e135fb7a7f6b276360c6b3fee69a42f080c28aa73de663ab/#:~:text=A%20quelle%20adresse%20se%20situe,la%20soci%C3%A9t%C3%A9%20AKCK%2C%20LLC)). State filings list Gary R. Groenhagen as the managing principal of the LLC ([www.verif.com](https://www.verif.com/societe/AKCK-LLC-9da64864e2199a59e135fb7a7f6b276360c6b3fee69a42f080c28aa73de663ab/#:~:text=Dirigeant%20principal)). The company has no public-facing business operations beyond holding its Ogle County farm parcels (its ownership and activities are privately held and not disclosed in public records).
neighbors.influence_justification: Small private landowner with no public profile; limited political or economic leverage beyond its property

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach principal Gary Groenhagen discreetly to gauge interest in project benefits or land transactions; emphasize mutually beneficial arrangements (e.g. premium purchase or lease) given the LLC’s likely financial focus

neighbors.name: Bank Of Ravenswood Trustee
neighbors.claims: “Bank of Ravenswood, as Trustee” holds title to this parcel as an Illinois land trust, meaning the actual beneficiary-owner’s name is not on public record ([generisonline.com](https://generisonline.com/a-comprehensive-guide-to-using-land-trusts-in-illinois-for-real-estate-benefits-privacy-and-limitations/#:~:text=Furthermore%2C%20land%20trusts%20create%20an,becoming%20the%20target%20of%20claims)). Ravenswood Bank was closed in 2010, and its accounts (including land trusts) were transferred to Northbrook Bank & Trust (Wintrust) ([www.fdic.gov](https://www.fdic.gov/resources/resolutions/bank-failures/failed-bank-list/ravenswood.html#:~:text=On%20Friday%2C%20August%206%2C%202010%2C,accounts%2C%20excluding%20certain%20brokered%20deposits)). The true landowner remains anonymous under the trust, with no known local involvement or stance documented.
neighbors.influence_justification: Anonymous/out-of-area ownership; no direct community engagement or local economic role

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate contact through the successor trustee (Northbrook Bank & Trust) to reach the beneficiary; frame proposals in financial terms (attractive buyout or lease) since the trust’s interest is likely purely monetary

neighbors.name: Farms For Life Foundation
neighbors.claims: Farms For Life Foundation is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit established in 2019 and based in Batavia, Illinois, with a Roman Catholic charitable mission focus ([projects.propublica.org](https://projects.propublica.org/nonprofits/organizations/832048247#:~:text=Category%3A%20Religion,NTEE)) ([projects.propublica.org](https://projects.propublica.org/nonprofits/organizations/832048247#:~:text=%2A%20Batavia%2C%20IL%20%2A%20Tax,2048247)). The foundation is funded and led by the Muetze family—Cathy Muetze serves as President, succeeding her late husband William Muetze who founded the organization ([projects.propublica.org](https://projects.propublica.org/nonprofits/organizations/832048247#:~:text=Key%20Employees%20and%20Officers%20,%240)). Farms For Life directs its resources to religious and community causes (for example, a $30,000 grant to Waterleaf Women’s Center and $25,000 to St. Jude Children’s Hospital) ([www.causeiq.com](https://www.causeiq.com/organizations/farms-for-life-foundation%2C832048247/#:~:text=Grantee%20%20,%2425%2C000)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Small private foundation; not a major employer or political actor, though backed by a wealthy local family

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Cathy Muetze (President) in dialogue emphasizing how the project can align with the foundation’s values or provide community benefits; highlight potential charitable partnership opportunities or proceed sensitively to avoid conflicting with their mission

overview_summary: Out of the three individual neighbors profiled, none have made any public statements indicating support or opposition to development, so all are classified as having an unknown stance. Additionally, none are prominent community figures or officials – all three are considered to have low local influence, with no high-influence neighbors identified. Three neighboring landowning parties were identified, and none have a documented stance on development (all are noted as unknown). One neighbor is a high-profile community member due to an elected park board position, while the other two have low public profiles or influence. Land ownership around the Rochelle project site is split between a solar development LLC backed by a national renewable energy investor and several private landholding entities (family trust, bank trustee, land trust, and family partnership). The developer (Rochelle Solar LLC) is an outside party pushing for a solar farm, whereas the other owners represent long-time local farmland interests who generally value agricultural use. These local landowners tend to keep a low profile publicly, but they collectively hold substantial acreage and could influence community sentiment against new development perceived to threaten farmland. Most neighboring parcels are held by non-local corporate or institutional owners – including a national insurance corporation and a farmland investment fund – indicating primarily absentee land investment motivations [Chicago Tribune](https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/environment/ct-illinois-farmland-ownership-corporate-climate-justice-20230827-e5bpml5y3vdyfbipwjxhv5ukvi-story.html) [Farm Progress](https://www.farmprogress.com/farm-business/who-owns-the-most-farmland-in-illinois-). The City of Rochelle is the one public, local stakeholder, likely supportive of development if it aligns with economic growth plans [City of Rochelle](https://www.excelinrochelle.com/content/business-environment/rochelle-dashboard.html). None of the private LLC or trust owners appear to have an active community presence, suggesting their stance will hinge on financial impact rather than local sentiment [Farm Progress](https://www.farmprogress.com/farm-business/who-owns-the-most-farmland-in-illinois-). Overall, the landscape features absentee investors focused on land value, and a municipal government focused on planned growth, which may present opportunities for negotiation and alignment rather than grassroots opposition. The neighboring landowners include the county government, a private LLC with local farming ties, a bank-operated land trust concealing its beneficiary, and a small charitable foundation. None are commercial developers; instead they represent local governance, passive land investments, and philanthropic ownership. Potential opposition would likely stem from farmland preservation interests or individual financial motives rather than any direct competitive development.
